text:
It is more along the lines of "Obsession" I can say the same for Minecraft and Call of Delinquents and Pukemon but what do I know. I only play fun replayable games (and I replay indie games too so do not assume that I only play mainstream AAA titans.)

In fact I am on my 3rd loop in Recutear. Non mainstream game. Then I remember "I used to go on and on about Zelda ALttP and Final Fantasy 6  (III US) so I guess I am guilty of obsession. I just do not listen to it. If I want to know anything about Undertale I will talk to my grandnephew who knows the game or I can just watch Markiplier (sp) play it.

text: Well.. there is that... never, ever read comments about anything you haven't watched\read\played yet.  The spoilers are inevitable.
author: Chrissy Sanders-Browning

text: Xenoblade isn't exactly a recent game, idk why so many people are complaingin about you "spoiling" it. It's like you spoil an Harry Potter film, man it's been out for years
author: Geniuz McDerp

text: +Geniuz McDerp Maybe because not everybody had the chance to play it immediately after it came out ? ... Its not for you too decides when something can be spoiled. .. Even if the game / movie / series is old ..respect the fact that there is a possibility that people pick it up / watch it later and not want to be spoiled about the events that are going to happen
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: @Recht_voor_zijn_raap Then you have to straight up get off the internet forever, cause you will get "spoiled" about everything 99% of the time. People will talk about what they want, and this is not the case but you also have to respect those who want to discuss a game/movie/series with others without having to care about people crying for spoilers. Also it's you that have read the comment, it's not like he forced you to, you should have stopped reading to "the moment you found out Bionis is"
author: Geniuz McDerp

text: +Geniuz McDerp thank you very much
author: Iamthepancake

text:
Exactly this.  I never look at youtube, facebook, pretty much ANYTHING when I really dont want something to be spoiled.  Last year with Star Wars I didn't even go online for 2 days to avoid them before I went to the cinema. ;)

Plus - like I said... Super Hydlide\Hydlide 3 spoiled the ending for me anyway and the "twist" nearly made me trip the table because I saw it coming from hours before hand. LOL

author: Spicy Twang

text: Just for the record, SOPA is not off the hook and can still be put up. Other countries are supporting this too (government wise), meaning if America still gets it passed, it will fall to other countries as well. I don't support piracy, but I don't condone it. To an extent, it is good free advertising, so long as it isn't overdone. But for Pete's sake, will all you retards stop fighting already? It's a video game, come ON people. If you respect it that much, you'd talk about the game, not piracy.
author: Sun E.

text: Well I don't like you JinGitaxias, always messing with my hand size...
author: ChainofDogs

text:
The Hitler thing was just a metaphore. I meant that you can't get everybody to listen to what you have to say, whether it's good or bad.
And what do you mean by "how dare you do that"? Is it too much of a trauma?
SOPA won't work. If they try it, it will just be removed shortly after they realize Google can't be used, and nor can Wikipedia and other big sites.
Also, I don't like you Americans. Especially not when you make me believe you all think a company like Nintendo doesn't earn much already.
author: Spicy Twang

text:
Yeah, what was "Operation Rainfall" for, if people would just download the game? And what was Hitler's try to remove all people with "flaws" if they didn't all die?
One doesn't have to follow some operation, especially not if they are like me, unknowingly what the actual heck "Operation Rainfall" is.
But I stand to my point, SOPA's dead already and the internet won't work like that so it wouldn't stay for long anyways.
And who'd wanna support the US anyways? Don't make me giggle.
author: Spicy Twang

author: eishikibahamut

text:
@AkumaUchitoru I believe "Xeno" refers to the other worldly.  For example, Xenophobia is a fear of unknown or otherworldly beings.  Similarly, Xenobiology is the study of otherworldly lifeforms.

Ragnarok is basically the end of Midgard (earth), when souls fight for Odin in Norse Mythology.
author: videohead85

text: It is completely unacceptable for Nintendo not to release this in the west. This is a high-quality game with very good reviews and potential, so I will be completely baffled if we don't get a confirmation of it coming to the west this year. But Nintendo of America still puts this game on their release schedule, so until they stop doing that, I'll continue to have hope that they're localizing it.

text: A superb arrangement, definitely can feel a bit of Baten Kaitos in there. Such a shame that this will probably never see the light of day outside of Japan. And I really don't understand that they're wiling to release Tales of Symphonia: Dawn of the New World overseas but NOT Tales of Graces, a far superior game. Also, I thought Tales games sold relatively well in the US? Eh, I don't know. Anger.
